sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>sun</radical> lets out one <radical>drop</radical>, and then another <radical>drop</radical>. The drops dance together in the air, combine, and when they hit the ground, up sprouts your <kanji>mother</kanji>!
meaningInfo: Picture these two drops of the sun morphing before your very eyes until they look exactly like your dear ol' mum. She's bright and shining like the sun, and she's looking down at you, her big drop-eyes full of tears.
readingMnemonic: Suddenly your <kanji>mother</kanji> points at you and laughs, "<reading>Haha</reading> (<ja>はは</ja>)!" She keeps laughing, haha haha haha, over and over. You start to feel uncomfortable.
readingInfo:
You thought your mother was going to say something sweet or profound or motherly, and instead she's pointing and saying, "Haha," over and over.

Yeah. That sounds like my mom.
